intro: Styphelia conantha, commonly known as the pink snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in spring. Styphelia conantha thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to coastal conditions with high salt exposure. It is often found in heathlands and is a characteristic component of the local flora.
